title: League of Legends "Chance of winning formula"
body:
So... Some friends and I were goofing around one night and made this... semi-legit looking formula that could actually work.

The formula is       100 - 20x + 5a = (Chance of winning a game in a percentage)
A = to the amount of people in your premade (excluding yourself)
X = Amount of strangers in your team 
Note : This doesnt work if youre playing solo
For Example if you and a friend decided to play a game, it would mean
A = 1
X = 3                         
Then we apply those numbers to the formula 
 100 - 20(3) + 5(1) = 45% (chance of winning)

But in the situation where A ≥ X, the answer to the formula must be divided by 2

For example, you're in a full premade team.
100 - 20(0) + 5(4) = 120
120/2 = 60%

But say if you wanted to take a step further.
then you apply an Elo Formula to your answer
The Elo formula is (100 - 20x + 5a) X (Your Team Elo Number ÷ Enemy Team Elo Number)

To find the Elo Number
**Bronze = 5
Silver/Unranked = 10
Gold = 15
Plat = 20
Diamond and above = 25**
to get an Elo Number for each team you add the ranks of each member of a team together. to continue the formula you get your team number then divide it by the enemy's team number.
E.g 
10 + 15 + 15 + 5 + 20 = Your Team Elo Number
15 + 10 + 20 + 20 + 15 = Enemy Elo Number
in this case 65 ÷ 80 = 0.8125 (
60 (Winning Chance Formula Answer) X 0.8125 (Elo Number Formula)
= 48.75% chance of winning

Basically, all you have to remember is
Chance of winning Formula = 100 - 20x + 5a
Elo Number Formula = (results of the winning formula) X (Your Team / Enemy Team Number)

My friends and I have wasted a good 2 hours on this..... we could have played 2 games of league

"When the hell would we actually use this"
"We won't"
"IN THE LOADING SCREEN" - the very special child

replies.body:
Pretty good post ;) Have you tested it out on any games yet?

Also could I recommend using MMR estimates instead of rank for your _"elo number"_? Rank can be really misleading in some cases, but MMR estimates will generally be more reliable. You can get some great MMR estimates [here](http://www.lol-mmr.com/) or on [op.gg](http://oce.op.gg/).
Yea, that would be a better idea. just replacing the Elo number with the mmr from op.gg could still work.

If only someone developed a system which accounted for the subdivisions, games with champion and the champion factor.
  
For example, one player might be B1 the other player B3, the B1 is a Yasuo main the B3 is a quasi-mediocre Riven main. 
In this instance the B1 would be superior on two counts, but the Riven would still have the possibility of winning because of the c factor. 

In this system they could also introduce win rates, but the more games played the less the win rate would be considered. 
For example, 1-20 games would have very high consideration, 20-40 medium consideration, 40-60 quasi-low consideration and 60-80 low consideration.
At first i was like, this isn't going to work, but then as I read more and more I was like actually wow this is actually amazing.
